
## Week 01: Aug 21 - Aug 25

We used the dice-rolling project as an example to discuss various concepts in Statistics. When we rolled 100 standard dice, we got a total near 350, because the population mean is 3.5 for fair 6-sided dice. When we rolled 100 special dice, we got a total above 400, because those dice were weighted. We learned a bit about $z$-scores as a way to determine whether an outcome is typical or outlandish.

* [Dice-rolling project](https://chadworley.github.io/precalculus/unit_01_stats/week_01/002_dice-rolling_project/002_dice-rolling_project.html)
* [Canvas questions](https://chadworley.github.io/precalculus/unit_01_stats/week_01/canvas_probs/week_01_shared1.html)
